intro: Vvedenskyella pumila, commonly known as the small pumila plant, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
